revised_title: Exploration and Findings of Brixham Cave
tldr: A committee of the Geological Society, led by Wm. Pengelly, explored the Brixham Cave in England. They discovered remains of the Reindeer above the so-called "Flint Knives," suggesting that the Reindeer continued to inhabit Britain after the appearance of humans. The exploration also led to the discovery of various deposits, including stalagmite, cave-earth, and a basement of pebbles derived from the Brixham district.
